intro: Agropyron angustiglume subsp. irendykense, commonly known as the Irendyken needlegrass, is a grass species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, spike-like inflorescence and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, lanceolate leaves with a rough texture, and its flowering period occurs in late summer. This subspecies is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in stabilizing soil in dry regions.
